title: W3.CSS Tags (Labels and Signs)

metadata.description: Learn about W3.CSS Tags (Labels and Signs) with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Tags: Done New! More Later! Tags as signs: Falcon Ridge Parkway STOP! WATCH OUT! W3.CSS Tag Classes W3.CSS provides one class for tags, labels, and signs: Class Defines w3-tag Rectangular black tag/label Tags, Labels, and Signs In the W3.CSS world there is no real difference between a tag, a label, or a sign. Tags are Rectangular The w3-tag class creates a rectangular tag (label or sign). The default color is black: Status: Done Example

Status: Done

Colored Tags Use a w3- color class to change the color of a tag: New! More Later! Example

New!

More Later!

Tag Sizes By default, a tag will inherit the size of its container. The w3- size classes (w3-tiny, w3-small, w3-large, w3-xlarge, w3-xxlarge, w3-xxxlarge, w3-jumbo) can be used to modify the size of a tag: 6 6 6 66 66 66 66 66 You might want to add some extra padding to large tags: Example 66 66 Letter Tags A U G U S T Example A U G U S T S A L E Example S A L E Signs Signs are nothing but large tags. London Zoo Example
London Zoo
Road Signs Falcon Ridge Parkway Example
Falcon Ridge Parkway
Large Signs The w3- size classes can be used to display large signs: IN CASE OF EMERGENCY: RUN LIKE HELL! Example IN CASE OF
EMERGENCY:
RUN LIKE HELL! 49 ,99 Example 49,99 Rounded Signs The w3-round- size classes can be used to add rounded corners to a sign: DO NOT BREATHE UNDER WATER Example DO NOT
BREATHE
UNDER WATER Rotating Tags Use the standard CSS transform property to rotate a sign: STOP Example STOP Note: transform:rotate() does not work in IE 9 and earlier. Spinning Tags The w3-spin class can be used to let a sign spin 360 degrees: STOP Example STOP ★ +1

summary: This tutorial covers W3.CSS Tags (Labels and Signs) concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use W3.CSS Tags (Labels and Signs) effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of W3.CSS Tags (Labels and Signs) and how to apply it in your projects.
